result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:05 PM Defendant Triston M Sobrilski in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Triston M Sobrilski.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Galaviz states they are waiting for test result. 
State does not have results back.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:07 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Triston M Sobrilski in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Triston M Sobrilski. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: dated 09-12-2022, filed by Wisconsin Community Service re: 90 day start of SCRAM

2:35 PM Defendant Triston M Sobrilski in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Triston M Sobrilski. 
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Bail remains as fixed. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Triston M Sobrilski
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-06-2022)
Prior: 328 Maple Ave # 201, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions.

2:23 PM Defendant Triston M Sobrilski in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Triston M Sobrilski. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Attorney Hughes appears as friend of the court. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. The defendant is provided with a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
